channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Do Trump's claims about Christian persecution in Nigeria match reality?
item.description: Aaron Zelin, a senior fellow at the Washington Institute for Near East Policy, analyzes the U.S. strike on ISIS targets in Nigeria and the message it sends.
item.content:encoded: Aaron Zelin, a senior fellow at the Washington Institute for Near East Policy, analyzes the U.S. strike on ISIS targets in Nigeria and the message it sends.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: U.S. ramps up Ukraine diplomacy as Zelensky meets Trump
item.description: President Trump hosts Zelensky amid intensified U.S. diplomacy aimed at ending Russia's war in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: President Trump hosts Zelensky amid intensified U.S. diplomacy aimed at ending Russia's war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Russia sends 3 Iranian satellites into orbit, report says
item.description: The report said that a Russian rocket sent the satellites on Sunday from a launchpad in eastern Russia.
item.content:encoded:
The report said that a Russian rocket sent the satellites on Sunday from a launchpad in eastern Russia.

(Image credit: Ivan Timoshenko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Crime fears drive South America's sharp turn to the right
item.description: From tough-on-crime politics to uneasy ties with Washington, Latin America's year-end story is one of a decisive rightward turn, insecurity at home and a more complicated relationship with the US.
item.content:encoded: From tough-on-crime politics to uneasy ties with Washington, Latin America's year-end story is one of a decisive rightward turn, insecurity at home and a more complicated relationship with the US.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: For Ukrainians, a nuclear missile museum is a bitter reminder of what the country gave up
item.description: The Museum of Strategic Missile Forces tells the story of how Ukraine dismantled its nuclear weapons arsenal after independence in 1991. Today many Ukrainians believe that decision to give up nukes was a mistake.
item.content:encoded:
The Museum of Strategic Missile Forces tells the story of how Ukraine dismantled its nuclear weapons arsenal after independence in 1991. Today many Ukrainians believe that decision to give up nukes was a mistake.

(Image credit: Anton Shtuka for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Trump says Ukraine and Russia 'closer than ever' to peace after talks with Zelenskyy
item.description: President Donald Trump's comments came shortly after meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at his Florida resort. But he acknowledged talks could still break down.
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump's comments came shortly after meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at his Florida resort. But he acknowledged talks could still break down.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Gangs use sexual violence to control communities in Haiti
item.description: Jacqueline Charles of the Miami Herald reports on how gangs in Haiti are using sexual violence as a tool of terror amid the country's deepening political and humanitarian crisis.
item.content:encoded: Jacqueline Charles of the Miami Herald reports on how gangs in Haiti are using sexual violence as a tool of terror amid the country's deepening political and humanitarian crisis.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: 'It's behind you!' How Britain goes wild for pantomimes during the holidays
item.description: Pantomimes are plays based on a well-known story — often a fairy tale — which are given a bawdy twist. The audience is expected to join in throughout, shouting as loudly as they can.
item.content:encoded:
Pantomimes are plays based on a well-known story — often a fairy tale — which are given a bawdy twist. The audience is expected to join in throughout, shouting as loudly as they can.

(Image credit: Ella Carmen Dale)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: How the U.S. has changed its approach to foreign aid this year
item.description: This year saw the dismantling of USAID, the United States' premier aid agency. What was the impact and what does the future of U.S. foreign aid look like in the health realm?
item.content:encoded: This year saw the dismantling of USAID, the United States' premier aid agency. What was the impact and what does the future of U.S. foreign aid look like in the health realm?
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: Myanmar is holding its first elections in five years
item.description: Myanmar's is holding its first elections since the military seized power five years ago. It could give the military junta more legitimacy.
item.content:encoded: Myanmar's is holding its first elections since the military seized power five years ago. It could give the military junta more legitimacy.
item.dc:creator: Michael Sullivan
